element.name: The Gee-gees by Fjon, Multi-cache (2/2)
element.long-description:
Leopardstown Racecourse
Leopardstown Racecourse is one of Europe's premier racing venues. Like the majority of Irish courses, it hosts both National Hunt and Flat racing. Located in county Dublin, a few miles south of the Dublin city centre. The course was modelled on Sandown Park Racecourse in England, and is regarded as a true test for any horse.
Completed in 1888 and acquired by the Horse Racing Board of Ireland in 1967. Many important races are held here and racing takes place all year round, with about 22 meetings per year.
The Leopardstown Hall of Fame honours famous Irish horse racing trainers, jockeys and horses like, Vincent O'Brien, Tom Dreaper, Pat Taaffe and Pat Eddery, Arkle, Dawn Run, Levmoss and Nijinsky.
Getting there
Leopardstown is easily accessible by car from either the M50 or the N11. Parking is available at Stages 1 and 2.
The cache is also accessible by public transport. The easiest way is to get the Luas Green Line to the Sandyford stop and walk 15 minutes to the Racecourse.
Please Note: it is recommended you do not try this cache on a race day. For fixtures, please see
here
The Cache
To find the cache you will need to visit a couple of locations first.
Stage One: N53° 15.892, W006° 11.665
At this location, take note of the name on the three black lampposts. How many letters are there in this name? Call this A
Stage Two: N53° 15.922, W006° 11.703
At this location, find the two years this place won Pub Of the Year. Take the second year and call it BCDE
Stage Three: N53° 15.964, W006° 11.642
At this stage you will see some colourful plastic seats. How many different colours are there? Call this F
Stage Four: N53° 16.062, W006° 11.685
At this stage there is a speed limit sign. What number is on it? Call this GH
Stage Five: N53° 16.153, W006° 11.641
At this stage you will see a sign - how many black arrows are pointing right? Call this I You now have everything you need to find the cache. The cache can be found at:
N53° (A+G+D)xB.(F-E)F(A+G)
W006° (G+F+B).(E+B)I(C+D)
Visit the Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

ul.li:
2010-05-13T19:00:00Z : Found it by Fitzet
Like hollmanr, I made a mistake with the Stage 3 calculation. Great minds think alike, etc.
Once I figured out that the cache was probably not located in someone's garden in Foxrock, I made the change and, with the hint, located the cache.
TNLN SL TFTC

2010-03-24T19:00:00Z : Found it by hollmanr
Found it during lunchtime break - 2nd attempt as I miscounted the nr of colors of chairs initially :) Had to wait for a single muggle with dog to move out of the area. GPS pointed sraight at location, so was easy find. Took nothing, left nothing Thanks !

2010-03-21T19:00:00Z : Found it by Mac Aroni Senior
Found on a sunny and very pleasant spring morning. Had a good wander around enjoying the sunshine. Unfortunately you can no longer walk around the race course. Would have made it even nicer and the dog would have enjoyed that immensely. That has not been possible for the past maybe 6 months, due to the fact that a walker was hit by a golf ball and subsequently sued Leopardstown Race course. So that put a stop to all walkers, joggers etc. And security will stop you, so no point in trying. TFTC. Co-ords spot on.

2010-02-06T20:00:00Z : Found it by Jumpin Jiminie
Had a lovely peaceful stroll around the area for this multi earlier this afternoon, whilst everyone else was running around trying to get everything ready for the Gold Cup tomorrow.
TNLNSL
Jamie

2009-11-30T20:00:00Z : Found it by vesborg
After I failed a few weeks ago at the final, I have found him today. It has to be sought only intense enough. Nachdem ich vor ein paar Wochen am Final gescheitert bin, habe ich ihn heute gut gefunden. Es muss nur intensiv genug gesucht werden. TFTC Frank

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: The Gee-gees
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Leopardstown Racecourse

Leopardstown Racecourse is one of Europe's premier racing venues. Like the majority of Irish courses, it hosts both National Hunt and Flat racing. Located in county Dublin, a few miles south of the Dublin city centre. The course was modelled on Sandown Park Racecourse in England, and is regarded as a true test for any horse.

Completed in 1888 and acquired by the Horse Racing Board of Ireland in 1967. Many important races are held here and racing takes place all year round, with about 22 meetings per year.

The Leopardstown Hall of Fame honours famous Irish horse racing trainers, jockeys and horses like, Vincent O'Brien, Tom Dreaper, Pat Taaffe and Pat Eddery, Arkle, Dawn Run, Levmoss and Nijinsky.

Getting there

Leopardstown is easily accessible by car from either the M50 or the N11. Parking is available at Stages 1 and 2.
The cache is also accessible by public transport. The easiest way is to get the Luas Green Line to the Sandyford stop and walk 15 minutes to the Racecourse.

Please Note: it is recommended you do not try this cache on a race day. For fixtures, please see here

The Cache

To find the cache you will need to visit a couple of locations first.

Stage One: N53° 15.892, W006° 11.665
At this location, take note of the name on the three black lampposts. How many letters are there in this name? Call this A

Stage Two: N53° 15.922, W006° 11.703
At this location, find the two years this place won Pub Of the Year. Take the second year and call it BCDE

Stage Three: N53° 15.964, W006° 11.642
At this stage you will see some colourful plastic seats. How many different colours are there? Call this F

Stage Four: N53° 16.062, W006° 11.685
At this stage there is a speed limit sign. What number is on it? Call this GH

Stage Five: N53° 16.153, W006° 11.641
At this stage you will see a sign - how many black arrows are pointing right? Call this I

You now have everything you need to find the cache. The cache can be found at:

N53° (A+G+D)xB.(F-E)F(A+G)
W006° (G+F+B).(E+B)I(C+D)

Visit the Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

Additional Waypoints

S2182VY - Stage Two
N 53° 15.992 W 006° 11.703

S3182VY - Stage Three
N 53° 15.964 W 006° 11.642

S4182VY - Stage Four
N 53° 16.062 W 006° 11.685

S5182VY - Stage Five
N 53° 16.153 W 006° 11.641
